title: (x) Stereohype.com navigation - handwritten {Stephen}
content:
Is the type used in the navigation of [http://stereohype.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20051126093904/http:/stereohype.com/) a font?

Or can you recommend similar free fonts, if not free cheap!

Thanks in advance.
author: NoDesign

comments.content: Thatâ€™s definitely handwritten. You might like [FF Justlefthand](http://web.archive.org/web/20051126093904/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=FF.735.1.5) or [Handsome Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20051126093904/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.aspx?i=1048&c=4&p=products/typedetail.aspx?image=SHT0000033) which features contextual alternates to make it act more like natural handwriting.

Or you could make your own [handwriting](http://web.archive.org/web/20051126093904/http:/www.fontifier.com/) into a font for $9 although a joining script might be tricky.  
Or look at [Dafont.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20051126093904/http:/www.dafont.com/en/theme.php?cat=602) although free, some of them might not be of the highest quality.  
Tim
